MAKE THIS CARD COLORLESS >:(
I WANT THIS CARD ON EVERY CHARACTER EVERY RUN
O.o

This card is an excellent tool to mitigate the curses of act 4. It's unlikely that you would draw more than 1 curse per hand anyways if you already have a  35+ card deck, and exhausting it and drawing a fresh card completely negates the issues with curses getting shuffled in by enemies. It is probably one of the best tools in the game to get around that particular snag in the late game gauntlet, and is an incredibly useful effect to strengthen the quality of your turns.

Even before act 4, this card is effective against tri-sentries, slimes, defect 1, ironclad 1, the chosen, tri-slavers, orb walker, repulsors, nemesis, and hermit 3. Defect 1 and ironclad 1 are probably the biggest reasons you might add this card to your deck in the early game. If you don't face one of those two, then you really aren't looking to add this card until very late in the run. Facing hermit in any act (thus assuring that neow will be powered up by it in act 4) can also be a reason to grab a repulsor early, as it will be even more effective than usual. 

With all that being said, there is a significant downside to this card. It's really expensive and usually won't do anything the turn you play it (you could draw a status or curse afterwards, but it's unlikely). Much as you might want one for the late game, taking it too early can be punishing, as it will be bad in the majority of fights leading up to act 4. If you are playing bronze automaton, then it has more wiggle room due to your "bug" themed status synergies, but on guardian, it's almost entirely an act 4 card. If you have a mummified hand, then you can also take this more freely. If your run is going extremely well or you have very strong frontloading, then you may be able to get away with taking this early on. There is however no denying that the best time to find it is just before fighting the act 3 boss, and that it will be a curse for most of the run. I do however believe that it is so good later, that it is worth that risk.

One other note is that as guardian, you can afford to have a certain number of silver bullet style card that are only good in a few fights. Defensive mode naturally helps you get punished less for awkward turns/draws, since there is generally a cap to the amount of damage you will take on any one turn. Stasis also tends to allow you to draw and play additional cards every turn if you can get it going quickly (planning, rereoute/recover, orb support), which means that drawing 1 bad card is not as heavily punished.

I will also say that bottom decking this during either act 4 fight feels pretty bad, but that's true of a lot of powers. At least neow doesn't really start dealing serious damage until turn 8, giving you plenty of time to find this. The only real advice I can give for that is to try and add more card draw to your deck as you approach the late game gauntlet, and hold onto high value potions like swift potion and gambler's brew to dig through your deck faster in those crucial fights.
